intro: Vilfa actinoclada, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of blue-green leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, followed by fluffy white seed heads. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water, featuring a deep root system. Vilfa actinoclada is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
